headline: Building Whiz
summary: Building Whiz, Indonesia’s first fintech company for teenagers, to empower a new generation of financial whiz kids. Ex-Facebook SWE, worked on several zero to one projects such as Blood Donations and Messenger Rooms. Graduated from Harvard College with a degree in Computer Science and Statistics. I'm passionate about working on projects that bring about positive social impact, and I'm excited to take on the next big challenge.

experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.description:
• Developed tools and libraries to help Android developers debug their applications more easily, such as the Tracing library, which provided a waterfall view and timing breakdowns of function and network calls
• Wrote a design doc and developed a framework for sending more detailed exception logs from a mobile client through RPCs, and receiving it on the server side for analysis

experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.description:
• Planned, developed, and launched the initial version of the Square Cash Android app in a small and fast-paced team
• Contributed to several of Square’s open source projects, such as Picasso and Scaffold

experiences.title: Co-Founder
experiences.description: Building the product and tech that will help the next generation of Indonesians make smart financial decisions

experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.description:
• Designed, conducted, and analyzed experiments on friending-related changes in Facebook’s Android app
• Designed and implemented infrastructure to make friendship statuses consistent across all surfaces and screens. This made use of Facebook’s technologies such as GraphQL and Dependency Injection

experiences.title: Senior Software Engineer
experiences.description:
Lite Interfaces Monetization
• Developed and optimized new ad experiences on the Facebook Lite App, which is targeted to users on lower-end devices in emerging markets, driving more ad revenue for Facebook.

Messenger Rooms
• Developed and helped to launch the Messenger Rooms product, helping people connect in more meaningful ways during COVID.

Blood Donations
• Kickstarted the blood donations product, which aims to solve the world’s safe blood shortage problem, from the ground up in a lean team environment and oversaw its release and expansion in India, Bangladesh, Pakistan, Brazil, and the United States
• Led and managed better engineering efforts within the team to improve product reliability and performance, and to increase developer efficiency. Responsibilities include setting goals and planning for the better engineering workstream, leading brainstorms, and supporting other engineers on the team
• Led the development of the blood request and blood donations hub features. This includes identifying project, scoping workstreams, and working with stakeholders such as the product manager and designer to prioritize and reach team goals
• Performed on-the-ground user research to develop the user journey and to identify gaps in the product
